alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 9:11PM EDT until April 06 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland and Harnett. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and ponding of water in urban or other areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 911 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This may cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Angier, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, Eastover, Coats, Stedman, Wade, Falcon, Linden, Anderson Creek, Vander, Bonnie Doone and Timberlake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
